title: Reinforcement Learning
content:
Fundamental Concepts

  • Markov Decision Processes: States, actions, rewards, transitions
  • Value Functions: State values and action values
  • Policy Optimization: Finding optimal behavior policies

Algorithmic Approaches

  • Dynamic Programming: Value iteration, policy iteration
  • Temporal Difference Learning: Q-learning, SARSA
  • Policy Gradient Methods: REINFORCE, Actor-Critic
  • Deep RL: DQN, PPO, SAC

Connections to Statistical Learning

Theoretical connections from your materials between RL and statistical learning theory, including exploration-exploitation tradeoffs.

Resources

ML theory materials - Theoretical foundations of reinforcement learning algorithms
